frontMatter.description: Follow this pattern to help users quickly see a list of items related to their personal information.
frontMatter.intro: Use this pattern to help users quickly see a list of items related to their own personal information and navigate to answers to their questions.

when_to_use.value: **Veteran-specific collections.** Displaying items like claims in progress, disability ratings, or ordered medical devices.
**Scannable groupings.** Creating scannable groupings of user-related items.
**Quick navigation.** Enabling quick content navigation with 'on this page' links.

design_principles.value: **Eliminate sidebars.** Consolidate page layout by eliminating sidebars.
**Mobile consistency.** Maintain mobile consistency with single-column format.
**Card-based display.** Use cards with status indicators and action links.

when_not_to_use.value: **Embedded form lists.** Don't use for lists embedded within forms.
**Complex filtering.** When complex filtering/sorting functionality is required.

examples.title: Personal item list
examples.description: User's claims, ratings, or orders displayed as cards with status and actions.

examples.title: On this page navigation
examples.description: Quick-jump navigation to different sections of the page.

how_to_build.intro: The pattern creates scannable groupings with quick navigation.

steps.value: Desktop: Sidebar-less layout with 'on this page' navigation component.
Include item list as cards with status indicators.
Add action links for detail pages.
Include Additional info components for contextual questions on cards.
Mobile: Single-column format maintaining desktop information hierarchy.

accessibility.value: Choose between action links or standard links based on use case.
Reference design system guidance on buttons vs. links.
Avoid overloading card elements with too much information.
